channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Patriotism, Diversity and the Election
item.description: We explore the battle for Senate control.

item.title: John Lennon’s Guitar From ‘Help!’ Is Sold for $2.9 Million at Auction
item.description: After appearing in multiple albums by the Beatles, the instrument was forgotten for more than 50 years before it turned up in the attic of a British countryside home.

item.title: Reality star Judge Judy says Gen Z are difficult to work with because they got too many trophies
item.description: Judge Judy says pandering parents have set Gen Z up to fail in the corporate rat race.

item.title: Trump Deliberations Continue, and New Delhi’s Hottest Recorded Day
item.description: Plus, Justice Samuel Alito refuses recusal calls.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Gaza Offensive Will Last at Least Through End of Year, Israeli Official Says
item.description: Israel’s national security adviser, Tzachi Hanegbi, appeared to reject the idea of a quick end to the war, though it was unclear what the intensity of the campaign would be.

item.title: Florida allows doctors to perform C-sections outside of hospitals
item.description: It is the first state to allow this, siding with a private equity-owned physicians group.

item.title: The Government Takes On Ticketmaster
item.description: Explaining a case that could reshape the multibillion-dollar live entertainment industry.

item.title: After Floods, Brazil Has a Surge in Homeless Pets
item.description: Officials in the southern part of the country have rescued more than 12,500 animals in recent weeks since catastrophic floods inundated cities and towns.

item.title: Jamie Dimon is so over spectators questioning whether his possible move from CEO to chairman would be bad for JPMorgan: 'How the hell do they know? There's no magic to it'
item.description: "The board should do the right thing—if the chairman is getting in the way of the new CEO they should go. If the chairman is helping the new CEO in a million different ways they should stay."

item.title: A ‘Laundry List’ or a ‘Feel’: Biden and Trump’s Clashing Appeals to Black Voters
item.description: President Biden and former President Donald J. Trump both see Black outreach as critical to winning in November. But their approaches differ in fundamental and revealing ways.

item.title: Mexicans Are on the Verge of Electing Their First Female President
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum is the front-runner in Mexico’s presidential race, but she is wrestling with the image that she could be a pawn of the current president.

item.title: Massive ransomware network taken down by ‘Endgame’ international police operation
item.description: Police arrested four “high value” suspects, took down more than 100 servers and seized control of over 2,000 internet domains.

item.title: Experts Question Alito’s Failure to Recuse Himself in Flag Controversy
item.description: Legal ethicists welcomed the fact that the justice gave reasons for staying on two Jan. 6 cases, a break from court tradition. But they said his rationale was open to criticism.

item.title: India’s Election Is the ‘Talk of the Town’ in Its Diaspora
item.description: The number of Indians abroad is small relative to the country’s population. Indian political parties want their support anyway.

item.title: Google promises $2 billion investment in Malaysia as Big Tech splurges on Southeast Asia spending
item.description: Google's pledge follows multi-billion dollar investment pledges from Microsoft and Amazon targeting Southeast Asia.
